edu.gvsu.dlunit

Class ISimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gvsu.dlunit.ISimulator

  • public abstract class ISimulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Interface to various digital logic simulators.
    Author:
    Zachary Kurmas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ISimulator.Extension
      Describes how a BitSit should be extended when being set on a larger input pin.

    • Method Detail

      • getPinWidth

        public abstract int getPinWidth(java.lang.String name)
                         throws NoSuchElementException,
                                InvalidElementException
        return the width of the pin
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the pin
        Returns:
        the width of the pin
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a pin named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not an input pin

      • setPin

        public abstract void setPin(java.lang.String name,
                            java.util.BitSet value,
                            int size,
                            ISimulator.Extension ext)
                     throws NoSuchElementException,
                            InvalidElementException,
                            InvalidWidthException
        Set the input pin name with a given set of bits.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the pin to be set
        value - the set of values to place on each individual pin in the set
        size - the number of bits to set.
        ext - whether zero-extend or sign-extend the value if the pin is wider than size.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an input pin named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the pin does not have width 1

      • setPin

        public void setPin(java.lang.String name,
                   boolean value)
            throws NoSuchElementException,
                   InvalidElementException,
                   InvalidWidthException
        Set a single input pin name with a given value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the pin to be set
        value - the binary value to place on the pin
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an input pin named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the pin does not have width 1

      • setPinSigned

        public void setPinSigned(java.lang.String name,
                         long value)
                  throws NoSuchElementException,
                         InvalidElementException,
                         InvalidWidthException
        Set the specified input pin to value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the pin to set
        value - the value to set the pin to.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an input pin named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the given value is too big for the width of the pin

      • setPinUnsigned

        public void setPinUnsigned(java.lang.String name,
                           long value)
                    throws NoSuchElementException,
                           InvalidElementException,
                           InvalidWidthException,
                           IllegalValueException
        Set the specified input pin to value.
        Parameters:

        value - the value to set the pin to.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an input pin named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the given value is too big for the width of the pin
        IllegalValueException - if value is negative

      • setRegister

        public abstract void setRegister(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.util.BitSet value,
                                 int size,
                                 ISimulator.Extension ext)
                          throws NoSuchElementException,
                                 InvalidElementException,
                                 InvalidWidthException
        Set the input register name with a given set of bits.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the register to be set
        value - the set of values to place on each individual bit in the register
        size - the number of bits to set.
        ext - whether zero-extend or sign-extend the value if the register is wider than size.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an input register named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element
        InvalidWidthException - if the register does not have width 1

      • setRegister

        public void setRegister(java.lang.String name,
                        boolean value)
                 throws NoSuchElementException,
                        InvalidElementException,
                        InvalidWidthException
        Set a one-bit register name with a given value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the register to be set
        value - the binary value to place in the register
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a register named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element
        InvalidWidthException - if the register does not have width 1

      • setMemorySigned

        public abstract void setMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                                     int beginningWordAddress,
                                     int[] values)
                              throws NoSuchElementException,
                                     InvalidElementException
        Sets memory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        values - an array of word values to be set. (The entire array will be set.)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • setMemoryUnsigned

        public abstract void setMemoryUnsigned(java.lang.String name,
                                       int beginningWordAddress,
                                       int[] values)
                                throws NoSuchElementException,
                                       InvalidElementException
        Sets memory using unsigned (positive) values only
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        values - an array of word values to be set. (The entire array will be set.)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • getMemoryWidth

        public abstract int getMemoryWidth(java.lang.String name)
                            throws NoSuchElementException,
                                   InvalidElementException
        return the width of the memory (i.e., the memory's word size)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory
        Returns:
        the width of the memory (i.e., its word size)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a memory named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element

      • readMemorySigned

        public long[] readMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                               long address,
                               int length)
                        throws NoSuchElementException,
                               InvalidElementException
        Get the values in the memory as signed long integers
        Parameters:
        name - the memory name
        address - the first word address to retreive
        length - the number of word addresses to retrieve
        Returns:
        the values as signed integers
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a memory named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element

      • readMemoryUnsigned

                                 long address,
                                 int length)
                          throws NoSuchElementException,
                                 InvalidElementException
        Get the values in memory as unsigned long integers
        Parameters:
        name - the memory name
        address - the word address
        length - the number of words to read
        Returns:
        the value in the memory as an unsigned integer
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a register named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element

                                              throws NoSuchElementException,
                                                     InvalidElementException
        Get the values in memory as BitSets.
        Parameters:
        name - the memory name
        address - the word address
        length - the number of words to read
        Returns:
        the values in memory as BitSets
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if no memory named name is found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not a memory

      • load

        public abstract void load(java.io.File file)
                   throws Utilities.UnreadableFileException,
                          Utilities.InvalidCircuitException
        Load a circuit from a file
        Parameters:
        file - the file containing the circuit
        Throws:
        Utilities.UnreadableFileException - if the file cannot be read (e.g., as a result of the permissions)
        Utilities.InvalidCircuitException - if the simulator cannot parse the file.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filename)
          throws Utilities.UnreadableFileException,
                 Utilities.InvalidCircuitException
        Load a circuit from a file
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file containing the circuit
        Throws:
        Utilities.UnreadableFileException - if the file cannot be read (e.g., as a result of the permissions)
        Utilities.InvalidCircuitException - if the simulator cannot parse the file.
